description: Verify that the Level Analytics page loads correctly when accessing /admin/player-analytics/levels with authenticated admin user
scenario: Admin user navigates to the level analytics page to view detailed performance metrics for each cybersecurity level
expected_results: Display the complete level analytics dashboard with level performance overview and detailed metrics for all 5 cybersecurity levels
procedure:
1. Login with admin user credentials (is_admin=True)
2. Navigate to http://localhost:5000/admin/player-analytics/levels
3. Verify page loads completely
4. Check page title displays 'Level Analytics - Phalanx Cyber Academy Admin'
5. Verify dashboard header with title and navigation buttons
6. Check all level analytics sections are visible and properly styled
7. Verify responsive layout and gradient background

description: Verify level analytics page requires proper admin authentication and redirects non-admin users
scenario: Non-admin user or unauthenticated user attempts to access level analytics dashboard
expected_results: Redirect non-admin users to home page with access denied message
procedure:
1. Ensure user is logged out
2. Navigate to http://localhost:5000/admin/player-analytics/levels
3. Verify redirect to login page
4. Login with regular user credentials (is_admin=False)
5. Navigate to level analytics page
6. Verify 'Access denied. Admin privileges required.' message
7. Check redirect to home page
8. Test admin_required decorator functionality

description: Verify level analytics page integrates correctly with data_analytics.py backend
scenario: Level analytics dashboard displays data from player_analytics_levels route with proper dummy data
expected_results: All level analytics data reflects the level_details structure defined in the backend route
procedure:
1. Verify level_details data structure matches dashboard display
2. Check all 5 levels (level_1 through level_5) are properly rendered
3. Test level name display matches backend data
4. Verify completion rates match level_details values
5. Check average time calculations and conversions
6. Test level-specific metrics integration
7. Verify template variable substitution works correctly
8. Check data type consistency between backend and frontend
9. Test error handling for missing level data
10. Verify JSON template rendering accuracy

description: Verify level analytics page is responsive across different screen sizes
scenario: Admin accesses level analytics on mobile, tablet, and desktop devices
expected_results: Level analytics adapts properly to different screen sizes while maintaining functionality
procedure:
1. Navigate to level analytics on desktop (1920x1080)
2. Verify max-width constraint (max-w-7xl) and grid layouts
3. Resize browser to tablet size (768px width)
4. Check level overview grid changes (grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-5)
5. Verify header layout adapts (flex-col sm:flex-row)
6. Resize to mobile size (375px width)
7. Check detailed metrics grid responsiveness (grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-3)
8. Test metric cards stacking on mobile
9. Verify button layout and sizing adaptation
10. Test landscape and portrait orientations

description: Verify level analytics focus on cybersecurity education effectiveness
scenario: Admin evaluates cybersecurity education progression and skill development through level analytics
expected_results: Level analytics clearly demonstrate educational progression from basic to advanced cybersecurity skills
procedure:
1. Navigate to level analytics page
2. Verify progression from Level 1 (89.2%) to Level 5 (18.9%) completion rates
3. Check skill complexity progression: information literacy → email security → malware → ethical hacking → forensics
4. Verify education-specific metrics for each level
5. Check learning outcome measurements
6. Test skill development tracking capabilities
7. Verify educational impact visualization
8. Check alignment with cybersecurity curriculum
9. Test metrics relevance to educational goals
10. Verify skill assessment accuracy
